Package main

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the game itself, the beginning of the game, and the end of the game.
    Version:
    May 26, 2020
    Author:
    Jeffrey Lee, Raeed Azom, Period: 1, Assignment: APCS Final Project, Sources: none

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Game​()
      Constructor: instantiates the menu and scores object whilst making the menu visible

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void endGame​()
      Runs to processes at the end of the game such as adding and sorting your scores and statisitics, and transferring the information to be desplayed on the EndScreen
      Level getLevel​()
      Accessor method for the lvl object: gets the lvl object and returns it.
      MenuScreen getMenu​()
      Accessor method for the menu object: gets the menu object and returns it.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Long> getScores​()
      Accessor method for the scores object: gets the scores object and returns it.
      void sortScores​()
      Sorts the list of scores in descending order
      void startGame​()
      Runs the processes to start a new level (once the button to start the game from the menu screen has been clicked): instantiates and starts a level object whilst making it visible

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game​()
        Constructor: instantiates the menu and scores object whilst making the menu visible

    • Method Detail

      • endGame

        public void endGame​()
        Runs to processes at the end of the game such as adding and sorting your scores and statisitics, and transferring the information to be desplayed on the EndScreen

      • startGame

        public void startGame​()
        Runs the processes to start a new level (once the button to start the game from the menu screen has been clicked): instantiates and starts a level object whilst making it visible

      • getMenu

        public MenuScreen getMenu​()
        Accessor method for the menu object: gets the menu object and returns it.
        Returns:
        MenuScreen menu - the menuscreen that is displayed upon launch

      • getLevel

        public Level getLevel​()
        Accessor method for the lvl object: gets the lvl object and returns it.
        Returns:
        Level lvl - the game level that the user is playing

      • sortScores

        public void sortScores​()
        Sorts the list of scores in descending order

      • getScores

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Long> getScores​()
        Accessor method for the scores object: gets the scores object and returns it.
        Returns:
        List scores - the list of scores the user earned
